definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: So you future relationships must be farther to the.
sentences.chinese: 這樣你們今後的關係肯定會越走越順當的。

sentences.english: The better the day, the better the deed.
sentences.chinese: 日子越美好，事業越順當。

sentences.english: We made excellent time and arrived in Spain in two days.
sentences.chinese: 我們一路很順當，兩天後就到了西班牙。

sentences.english: My work always goes badly when I'm tired.
sentences.chinese: 我疲倦時工作總是不順當。

sentences.english: He adjusted himself very quickly to the business environment of the country.
sentences.chinese: 他使本人很快順當了那個國家的商業環境。

sentences.english: Our work is just bumming along.
Did you get on it a bit?
